newsitem.title: POLAND: POLISH BGZ BANK GETS GBP 13 MLN TO HELP DEBTORS.
newsitem.headline: POLISH BGZ BANK GETS GBP 13 MLN TO HELP DEBTORS.

text.p: The British Know-How Fund has granted Poland's state-owned farming bank, Bank Gospodarki Zywnosciowej SA (BGZ), 13 million pounds in aid for the restructuring of food firms, BGZ official said on Tuesday.

"The British government has earmarked 13 million pounds for the restructuring of the Polish food and agricultural industry," Andrzej Szczepek, bank's deputy president, told a news conference. He said BGZ wanted sum would be used to prepare restucturing programmes for about 600 companies.
